config.question: Which of the following was an effect of the Panic of 1893 and the depression that followed?

choices.content: The value of U.S. currency increased.
Three million U.S. workers were unemployed.
The free coinage of silver was banned.

answer_3.response: Consider This: The panic caused a heavy drop in the gross national product of the United States. Frightened, people sold stocks and other assets to buy gold. On April 22, 1893, the Treasury’s gold reserve, which represented the government’s commitment to the gold standard, fell below $100 million for the first time since the 1870s. See L.O. 20.3 What were the main political and labor effects of the panic and depression of the 1890s?
